results.description:
Sprainbrook Organic Nursery and Garden Center is devoted to spreading organic techniques throughout our Westchester community and beyond. Main focus is to learn how to grow more beautiful plants using Mother Nature's best and there are opportunities to learn and grow from Master Gardener and Sprainbrook owner, Al Krautter. We will also celebrate with some pot-luck gatherings to share the bounty of our gardens. Sprouting, micro-greens and edible organics are a primary focus as well as conversion to organics as a social commitment to our future. Open to all kinds of related inquiry as well as opportunities to grow and intern in the Sprainbrook Greenhouses.

There is a spring fed swimming pool and the gardens on this 9+ acre site are flourishing in many ways.  Bring your dogs as we are pet friendly too (usual clean-up still required) and let them swim in the pool too.  See pictures in album for more view of Sprainbrook Nursery.
results.name: Sprainbrook Organic Gardeners

results.description:
THE NEIGHBORS

Improving Neighborhood Livelihood

****WE ARE GOING TO CLEAN UP NEW YORK CITY ON NEIGHBORHOOD AT A TIME****

We are your Neighbors. Among us are your family, friends, associates and colleagues. Together this community can provide a fellowship of inspiration and training. Inspiration to pursue the goals that your likeminded Neighbors can assist you obtain. As well as the training to do it. It's our belief if you are in the right Neighborhood or home you will do all that you are meant to do in the great City of New York. You will live out your destiny. With the guidance from your fellow Neighbors we will provide better quality of life for all of New York City. 

Founder
Phil Cappadora Jr.

“It’s a networking group I started for actors and artists alike. With this, we can host events and inform any members on what other members are doing. Like an open mic for charity. A walk to raise AWARENESS for a cause. Workshops to Prevent or Stop wrongful doings and lastly to Party among friends.  

* Our Mission is to improve each Neighborhoods Livelihood one block at a time. Through Theatre, Fundraisers, Mixers and Film we will focus our energies on the youth of our community and building strong families.

* What should you expect: Sanitary streets & sidewalks. Our Neighborhoods reflect traditions, culture, hospitality and values.

* Who should join: Parents, Uncles, Aunts, Grandparents and all Neighbors!  

* Why they should join: To cultivate New York City.

WE ARE LOCATED ON “MeetUp”

 Phil Cappadora Jr.

All sponsorship will be made available after the Screenings and Approval by founder Phil Cappadora. All sponsors and endorsements will be used to promote a company and its products. Services from THE NEIGHBORS will include online promotion and sanitation improvement for better customer service satisfaction!  
To Apply: PCAPPADORA@GMAIL.COM
Subject Line “NEIGHBOR (your name)”


~I know everywhere you go in the city the Neighborhood reflects the culture and traditions of that area. Right now my Neighborhood is unsanitary. And I want that to change. So I'm going to clean it up. And with the neighbors chipping in, we can spread this mode of hospitality through out the whole city. 

* Our Meetup Group is about the common good. Through Theatre, Fundraisers, Mixers and Film we will focus our energies on the youth of our community using after school programs and Summer Classes including; Acting, Movement, Voice & Speech, Puppetry and more. This group is also for the adults. From this Network you may find men and women who can develop a REEL or V/O disc to better market yourself, plus the word of mouth of all the Neighbors to Support you.

* Who should join: Anyone who has an idea but doesn't know how to develop it into reality. It can be a script idea. Also it can be a show. If you know of a charity that's lacking volunteers, the Neighbors will assist you spread the word. 

* Why they should join: To learn, share, and have fun.


* What members can expect: Expect us to be there when you need help. One of the primary functions of this organizations is to represent artists who have been working among union actors and are getting short changed. Say for example; its pouring rain on a set in Brooklyn and you ask to go inside to holding. When the P.A. says no then you need to hang out and wait, as it rains. BUT a Union Actor standing next to you gets "WET" pay. Others do not. And I don't think that's fair. Same goes for Meal Penalties. They are not applied to the NON Union workers and that also is not far. Also as a sole proprietor on set NON Union have no say in there rates/wages for work. That also is Unfair. 

Our Short Term goal as of now is not to UNIONIZE but to Stand United. Fair wages for fair work.
results.name: The Neighbors

results.description: In general terms Convergence of Cultures proposes to facilitate and stimulate dialogue between cultures, to oppose discrimination and violence based on active non-violence and non-discrimination to address these currents at their root, and to bring these proposals to all latitudes. In particular: a) To promote relationships between different cultures, "building bridges among people of all cultures". By means of organizing gatherings and ambits for interchange among people from different cultures. The intention of the interchange is not only to make their own cultures, concerns and aspirations known, but to allow a true dialogue oriented towards the search for common elements that are present in the hearts of different peoples and individuals. b) To denounce and struggle against all kinds of overt or covert discrimination Through different types of campaigns which allow the full expression of human rights; for the free circulation of human beings throughout the planet and for the possibility of everyone to choose the place and conditions in which they want to live; to improve the present and build a common future. c) To disseminate its ideas and activities Making contact with all the cultures in different countries, with the intention to disseminate and bring together people and organizations around the studies and activities of Convergence of Cultures.
results.name: Convergence of Cultures

results.description:
Our dragon boat crew came together in 1996, formed by a group of friends in New York City. Searching for an outlet for our irrepressible competitive spirit, we came together to test ourselves against the best in the competitions. Every spring through fall, we can be found spending our weekend mornings practicing in a never ending struggle to improve. But that doesn't mean we don't have fun! To be Xtreme means not only to work hard, but to play hard. Besides the weekly practices, there are also team events. There are meetings, dinners, outings and our annual team barbecue. It's because we combine the best of teamwork, competitiveness and fun that Xtreme NY has grown every year. Since 1996, we have grown from a handful of people to over 60 members. We are always happy to open our arms to anyone willing to make the commitment to our organization. And in return, that person doesn't just become a member of a team, that person becomes a part of the Xtreme NY family.

All are welcome to attend practices and try us out. After three practices, we will ask if you would like to become an official team member.
results.name: Xtreme NY Dragon Boat Racing (Queens, NY)

results.description:
Being a mother is hard enough. Keeping your family in order when you can barely keep yourself in order can be simply overwhelming. That's why there's the ADHD Mom's Group. Do you: Feel restless or on-edge and unable to relax? Push things off or have trouble finishing them? Struggle to get yourself or your kids out on time? Get distracted from things like monitoring your kids? Misunderstand or forget things you were supposed to do? If you answered "yes" to any of these questions, then you might have adult ADHD. But there's help! Join other local women just like you for a cognitive-behavioral group for moms with adult ADHD. You will learn practical, effective strategies together, in a positive, supportive environment. This 13-week research-based program, conducted by experienced clinical psychologist, Dr. Bin Goldman, targets essential skills, such as getting started on tasks, following through, time management, problem-solving, planning, organization, keeping track of things, and others. Meetings held at 451 West End Ave., Apt. 2E. Each group session is 2 hours long. Times based on members' preferences.

Please note, this is a fee- based group.
results.name: ADHD Moms Therapy Group

results.description:

results.description:
Beautiful luxury hotel bars and lounges are both relaxing and stimulating. And they neither have to come with a pretentious attitude nor an outrageous price tag. This meetup group will have nothing to do with pretense, but will have everything to do with kindness, generosity of spirit, intellectual discussion, and exciting nights on the town.

Many of our favorite hotels are conveniently bunched between 55th and 60th streets, which makes for easy venue-hopping. The St. Regis, the Peninsula, the Parker Meridien, the Four Seasons, the Plaza, the Ritz-Carlton, the Mandarin Oriental. On the East Side are the Pierre, the Plaza Athenee, the Surrey and the Carlyle. We'll certainly hit up the "trendy" hotels as well, among them the Standards, the Gansevoorts, the W's, and the Dreams. And many more.

While we may have some of our parents' tastes, this is definitely NOT our parents' meetup. This group is oriented to those in their 20s, 30s and 40s (and a few beyond that if they can keep up).

We'll also sometimes go to cultural events and to hear live music. You may additionally find us on various types of boats. And whether it's on a hotel rooftop or in a lovely park, when good weather beckons us outside, we can't resist.

If somehow you got the impression that this is not a "party" meetup, think again. This is essentially a party meetup. Non-drinkers are welcome, but as a group we will often be drinking. Drinking, talking, having great conversations.

I said that this was essentially a party meetup, but that's not quite correct. We are essentially a group of very kind, thoughtful, down-to-earth and well-intentioned people, who are on the intellectual side and love to talk about ideas of all kinds. And love to have scintillating and delightful nights on the town while doing so. Is this you? Then you've found your home.

This is intended as a small meetup group, and we are planning to have relatively small events. We'll be starting with events for 10-12 people, and perhaps later allowing as many as 20 people at certain events. Most of all we are looking for a quality experience for everyone, not to have a large party with random strangers. Thank you.
results.name: Manhattan Luxury Hotel Bars, Lounges and Restaurants

results.description:
Find your perfect half playing the chess -literally! If you are excited to try new things, if you love playing the chess or you want to learn how to play, and if you are looking forward to socialising at the same time, you are looking at the right group! We are going to play the chess a little different than the usual. There will be only HALF chess sets, meaning that everyone will get half the board and one side of the chess pieces (16 of them). Finding your other half among your group mates will be your job! It is a great way to socialise and meet with new people who share the same passion you have: playing the chess and if you don't know how to play, no worries, I'm sure you'll meet someone who will be willing to help you out!

Join us if you are ready to play the chess, break the ice, and form valuable connections! 


You can also check out our website for the product we are developing with this same idea:

www.chesmate.com

WELCOME! This Meetup is for everyone interested in the healing powers of Sound & authentic traditional Shamanism. Come join the fun at the Sound Healing Circle, and you can learn Native American Songs & Indigenous dances, experience the harmony of toning with sound, the joy of ecstatic dance and experience shamanic journey to music. 

All levels of experience are welcome, All traditions are honored. Whether you are a beginner to spirituality, Sound Healing, Shamanism & Divination or a seasoned journeyer, there are events for all.

Please join if you are interested in:

Power Animals, Spirit Guides, Nature Spirits, Ancestors, Angels, Shamanic Journey, Sound Healing, Native American Flute, Crystal & Stones, Magical Herbalism, Spiritual Cleansing, Space Clearing, Energy Healing, Traditional Magic, Intuition, Precognition, Clairvoyance, Telepathy, Empathy, Auras & Chakras, Dreams, Tarot, Palmistry, Astrology, Numerology, Crystal Gazing, Dowsing, Past Lives & More!

Our Events Are Conveniently Located In A Beautiful UNION SQUARE Location!

ABOUT THE ORGANIZER: Sage Logan was raised with family practices of the African American folk magic tradition known as Rootwork. He is also a longtime Shamanic Practitioner, and has learned sacred ceremonies and healing techniques first hand, from indigenous healers, from the Lakota & Cherokee traditions, healers from Peru & Ecuador, the Maori of New Zealand, South African Sangoma's & many more. Sage is a core member & organizer, of the NY Shamanic Circle, New York City's eldest Shamanic non-profit organization.

If you have any questions, feel free to call Sage at (917) 504-1724

results.description:
Just seeing if there are other musicians out there who like to compose film and game oriented music for hobby, ideally those just out of college like myself and have too much time on their hands. :P The reason for this group is that most other groups I've seen are more networking/career oriented, whereas I'm looking more for other musicians to collaborate and bounce ideas with.

The type of music for this group is less pop/techno/dance/house and more along the lines of stuff from film or video games, such as piano arrangements or orchestral pieces produced using sound libraries like EWQL or Vienna. Remixes and covers of existing songs are also welcome.  I don't really know the genre, but feel free to listen to samples below to get a feel for what I'm talking about.

Example of music this group will be aimed towards:  
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PJmlURZOKTI
http://www.newgrounds.com/audio/listen/395356
http://www.kotobox.net/ (my own work)

The idea for this group is to meet often and share current songs you are working on, as well as get feedback and collaborate with others. We can do improvisation sessions where we just play instruments together to brainstorm ideas for songs. Maybe we can even have days where we just spend hours composing as many songs as we can as a group. Feel free to suggest events or share ideas as well as your own projects in the discussion board.
results.name: Composing Film and Game Music NYC

results.description:
Leukemia & Lymphoma Society

The mission of The Leukemia & Lymphoma Society (LLS) is to cure leukemia, lymphoma, Hodgkin's disease and myeloma, and improve the quality of life of patients and their families.

LLS exists to find cures and ensure access to treatments for blood cancer patients. We are the voice for all blood cancer patients and we work to ensure access to treatments for all blood cancer patients.

Team In Training

Team In Training (TNT) is the flagship fundraising program for LLS and the only endurance sports training program for charity that raises money for blood cancer research. TNT and LLS are changing the landscape of blood cancer, not someday but today, making TNT the perfect way to fundraise.

Ambassadors for Cures

Team in Training’s Ambassadors for Cures is a new, flexible, and fun way for dedicated volunteers to support the Leukemia & Lymphoma Society's mission. Ambassadors are trained representatives in their own community who can create their own schedules based on how involved they would like to be.

Contact

For more information or to sign up today:

• Visit our website at http://www.teamintraining.org/nj/volunteer/

• Call or email Stephanie Sims at stephanie.sims@lls.org or 908.956.6620

• Complete our Volunteer Form at https://www.llsform.org/0350FS01/form6/index.html

GO TEAM!
results.name: Volunteer to Join the Fight Against Blood Cancer!

ADELANTE GALLERY IS a contemporary fine art gallery created as an alternative to the dictated constraints of the commercial gallery world. The gallery reflects a broad range of styles, sensibilities and media, from realism to abstraction, spanning painting, drawing, photography, printmaking, mixed media and experimental work. Its strength lies in its diversity of style, ages and viewpoints. Adelante Gallery Artists have the opportunity to exhibit their work, and share with the audiences their vision, techniques and to act as a catalyst for new ideas in contemporary art and culture. Adelante Gallery highly exacting aesthetic standards are continuously refreshed by new members.

Adelante Gallery is located in the heart of the famous Chelsea art district, on second floor of 25 West 31th Street creating important accent within creative space occupied by visual and performing artists, photographers, models, dance professionals, fashion designers and event planners. The gallery is frequented by art lovers looking to find and buy original artwork.

results.description:
BNI is a business and professional organization whose primary purpose is to exchange qualified, exclusive business referrals. In fact, since 1985, BNI members worldwide have exchanged over 15 Million business referrals, totaling over $8 Billion in new business.  In BNI, only one person per profession may join a local chapter.  And that means once you join us, you have completely locked out your competition.  However, if your competition joins first, the opportunity is gone. BNI is category exclusive, so once you join, you will not be competing with someone in the same profession for referrals.  If you consider networking and/or referrals to be an important part of new business development for your business, BNI represents a high-value opportunity for you.

As a reminder here's why we wake up early Wednesday mornings. 98% of businesses rely on referrals to build new business. ONLY 3% of businesses have a strategy to generate those referrals. Our BNI networking meetings are a proven word of mouth marketing referral generating strategy. Networking requires commitment. The most successful chapters of BNI are comprised of participants who are sincerely committed to helping one another through networking. They are a team. As a participant in BNI, you are responsible for complying with the policies and guidelines of the organization.
results.name: BNI Chapter 61

This is a spiritual - non denominational, non religious, non-sectarian Satsang group focused on the practice of the teachings of that great sage of the sages Sri Ramana Maharshi who walked amongst us a mortal in human body but was not a human being like us.

results.description:
This group brings together entrepreneurs, creators, business professionals, and interested parties to explore trends and opportunities in emerging economies (ie. Africa, Asia, Latin America etc.), and the next billion underserved people. 

During our monthly events we will:

• Discuss current and future emerging market trends, new ideas, and business models.

• Learn from individuals, businesses, and organizations that are creating products, services, and experiences for the next billion connected people.

• Explore designing smarter, more accessible emerging market cities to enable strong startup ecosystems and a global creative class. 

Our community-led events are designed to be interactive, informative, insightful, and inspiring. Whether you are already working in emerging economies or are just curious about opportunities, join us to share ideas and connect. 

Join our community and be inspired.


####

• By 2020, the global middle class will be 3.1 billion. The vast majority of them will come from the emerging markets of Asia, Africa and Latin America.

• There will be 3.2 billion people online by the end of 2015. Most of them will be in emerging markets in Asia, Africa, Middle East, and Latin America .

• More than 60 percent of the world’s population is predicted to live in cities by 2030, with the majority of this urban growth taking place in Africa and Asia.

results.description:
If you are interested in losing weight with a group, this Meetup might be right for you.

I have always struggled with my weight. I've tried Weight Watchers (I made lifetime at age 22 - haven't seen that weight since!), South Beach (NEVER AGAIN!), and gluten free (how I missed you pizza...)

How many of you have tried every diet out there without true success? Diets are temporary. Your lifestyle is more important !

Tell me about your journey and I will share mine in a small group setting. Let's chat about YOUR goals, YOUR lifestyle, and ways that I can help you gain that energy back. I don't promise a miracle - and all results are individual. What I can tell you is that my friend Christina and Advocare saved my life; I want to pay it forward. Come and join in on a 24 Day Challenge - just 24 Days to a new you! 

Here is my before photo....

And the after.

When you join, I'll also invite you to the Private 24 Day Challenge Support Facebook page that has great ideas and recipes for your journey. Visit www.24daychallengemovie.com and my website.

I took my first challenge seriously and lost 15 pounds and 14 inches all around. I just am completing my second (early September 2015...stay tuned.)  I feel so much better! More energy, focus, clear skin, healthy hair, and I never feel hungry. My total cholesterol dropped 23% over the past three months - the bad dropped almost 30%. Sugar levels dropped too! 

A real story -- my friend Mike has been complaining of soreness and lack of energy. He gained over 100 pounds in the past 10 years. He started his first challenge in August. He lost over 15 pounds in 10 days. His goal is lose that weight by next year and complete a half-marathon with me. He has two children and wants to live for them. My friend Dee has three children and works multiple jobs, which means long hours. She wants to have better focus and energy to keep up with her day-to-day schedule. She lost 11 pounds in her first 24 Day Challenge.

I would love for you to join me and when we have a few people, I will reach out to you for the meetup at a Starbucks or even at the park (like Scalzi or even the beach if you want.) Thank you so much for your time!! Please feel free to email me, Tina, at weightloss4u@gmail.com.
results.name: Stamford 24 Day Weight Loss Challenge

If you're looking for an alternative to the status quo, an alternative to the bar scene, an alternative to a life without purpose, then this group is for you! All are welcomed.

results.description:
Picture this.... You are sitting at home watching tv and your favorite singing show is on... As you are drinking your alcoholic beverage you say to yourself "hey I can do better then that guy".... You pick up your cell phone and open up meetup, scroll through groups and stop... You finally found it! A group of people that think the exact same thing! Welcome to Bay Ridge Karaoke! Who?

My name is Tommy and I love to sing! I have been doing karaoke for years and try to find the best places to go... I'm not talking about handing the mic over and singing... No no no I'm talking about getting everyone involved and making it a time you will never forget!

Where?

Meetings happen mainly in the area of Bay Ridge... But that doesn't mean only Bay Ridge residents can join... That would be neighborhood-ist Why?


Why the hell not! You want to meet others who love to sing? Want to show off your talents (or lack of)? Do you just not care about making a fool of yourself for the benefit of the crowd? Then join us in the awesome that is Bay Ridge Karaoke!

Final thoughts:

At the end of the day it's simple... We are a fun loving group of singers who like to hit the high notes along with slamming some beers down...So if you love to sing and have a good time, this is the group you want to join!
results.name: Bay Ridge Karaoke!

results.description: Introducing MAKE art lab !!! A craft studio & event space. Calling all crafters and would be crafters. Let's get together and make cool stuff. Crochet, sewing, jewelry making, soap making, every kind of DIY...you name it we make it! We're bringing back the lost art of making in an awesome way. MAKE art lab was founded by DIY expert Crystal Sharpe-Hampton. I am a craft professional who saw a need for fun, approachable crafts activities for creative (but busy) people. I took my knowledge of the crafts industry, combined it with the NYC DIY scene, added in delicious food, great style, and good music–and Make art lab was born. I'm just ecstatic MAKE art lab is a bright, cheerful, airy creative space that offers a full schedule of modern craft and DIY classes. I'm just ecstatic to about this Meet Up. Hope to see you there!

results.description:
#ODSC brings together the open source and data science communities with the goal of helping its members learn, connect and grow.

The focus of this Meetup group is to allow #ODSC to work with Meetup groups, non-profits, and other organizations to present informative lectures, workshops, code sprints and networking events to help grow the use of open source languages and tools within the data science and data-centric community. As such, our specific goals are:


1. Build a collaborative group to work with other Meetup groups, non-profits, and other organizations.

2. Promote the use of open source languages and tools amongst data scientists and others.

3. Host educational workshops.

4. Spread awareness of new open source languages and tools that can be used in data science.

5. Contribute back to the open source community.


Who is this meetup for?

• Data engineers, analysts, scientists, and other practitioners

• R, Python and other software engineers who work with data or want to learn

• Data visualization developers and designers

• Non-technical team leads, executives, and other decision makers from data centric startups and large companies looking to utilize open source tools


How can you get involved?

• Attend events, network and precipitate!

• Give a talk or workshop that meets our goals

• Volunteer to help the group (social media, website, blogging)

• Provide us with a venue

• Sponsor food and drinks
results.name: New York Data Science #ODSC

results.description:
Do you want more out of your life?  Do you wish you had more time to do the things you love?  Are you lost and confused about your health and nutrition?  Do you wish someone would just take the time to listen to your concerns?  Do you get to the end of your day with an overwhelming exhaustion and wonder how others have the energy to go work out?  Do you wish you had more realistic tools to manage your stress?  Meet Jill Corrigan and make Women's Wellness Warriors a part of your journey to a healthier, empowered and vibrant lifestyle. 

What can Jill do for you?  She can provide a safe and non-judgmental space with a group of supportive and like-minded women for you to talk to about your health concerns, stressors, and whatever curveball life throws your way.  Together we can help you to take control of your health and life by providing you the tools to make informed choices on food and strategies for creating a healthy life balance.  Join us for workshops where we will discuss topics to arm you with the information you need to empower yourself to live the healthy life that you’ve envisioned for yourself.


Find out more about Jill at http://forthehealthofit.life
results.name: Women's Wellness Warriors

results.description:
Tired of Watching life go on around you?! Well I am. I know we are often overlooked so I started this community for Young adults 18 to 39 like myself living with Cancer or survivors, friends, family & supporters regardless of type and diagnosis. Activities held in Queens, LI, Brooklyn & nyc.

My goal is to bring together a diverse group of people who share a love for life to take part in fun & interesting activities & events involving nature (State park/ farm/ serenity), the outdoors , healthy lifestyles, Photography, socials, chats, walks in the park & maybe even some writing classes. 

Lower energy levels should not banish us to the geriatrics ward so we'll combine non-too-strenuous activities depending on ability level with fun!! No matter where you are in your journey there is no competition about who has what condition, just a positive & encouraging space for young adults, professionals & non-professionals alike. 

It is assumed that you've been cleared to or will be able to participate in activity. 

...So what are you waiting on? Let's get on with the business of life. We welcome everyone so get off your A$$ & join in & Invite Your friends Too! :) 

I will try to put together programming that we all enjoy but your suggestions are welcome as well. Pls be sure to Upload an actual photo.

Looking forward to meeting you! The nature of the meetup a will be personal so hopefully no one feels left out as happens on some other groups.

Learn How to Sync your Calendar to Google & Smartphone & never miss another event.

Our Website: VoicingItOUT.com (More ways to connect there)

Our Fb Page is: Voicing-It-OUT-The-Young-Adult-Cancer-Collective

TEA & THERAPY NIGHT

NYC CARIBBEAN FOOD FESTIVAL
